artifact.content: Administrator can shutdown the system
Users can make and receive calls; user is notified if user does not have the appropriate privileges
Dial tone is given to user when the phone is taken offhook
4 digit phone number, with the first digit as a prefix and the last 3 digits mapping to a specific phone
System load is checked, incremented and decremented appropriately during the call process
Phone number dialed is mapped to another user�s IP
Call must completed within a specified time
If callee�s phone is busy, caller will receive a busy tone
Callee�s phone will ring after caller places a call to the callee
Audio connection will connect to caller and callee
Caller will receive a timeout signal if callee does not pick up the phone
Connection is terminated when either party hangs up
Important numbers are dialed by pressing one button
Each phone number must be distinctly mapped to an IP
Administrator has a higher priority in accessing the mapping than a caller
Administrator must have access to all features of the system console
Administrator must login to the system console using a correct combination of login and password
Administrator login will timeout after a specified time or failures
Only one administrator can login to the system at one time
Only one administrator modify system data at one time
System should check administrator�s data input to ensure data integrity
Administrator can add, edit and remove an user account
User records are retained indefinitely when an user account is remove
Administrator can see hardware information through System Console
Administrator can request a hardware test through the System Console
System will issue automatic hardware test every 30 seconds
Automatic hardware test results are logged into a file
Administrator can enable and disable a specific phone in the system through the System Console
Administrator can reset a specific phone�s call processing software through the System Console
Administrator can specify the maximum system capacity in the System Console
All calls will be recorded onto the system
Bills are issued to all users with outstanding balance at the end of each billing period
Administrator can see the phone bill through the System Console
Bill payments are recorded by the system administrator through the System Console
Administrator can specify billing plan for each user through the System Console
System should check administrator�s input to ensure billing period is valid
Caller can choose to block certain incoming calls
System finds available IP and phone number and assigns to phone
Administrator can change the phone number and the IP assigned to a phone device
Administrator can disassociate and IP and a phone number from a phone
Verify there exists a callee for the dialed phone number and mapped IP
Phone Subsystem collects digits dialed by the phone
Administrator can add a new phone number IP mapping
Administrator can look up a phone number IP mapping via the System Console
Administrator can update phone number IP mapping via the System Console
System checks if an user is already existing before adding an user
System checks if a phone is available before adding an user
Administrator can modify a phone number or an IP of an user account
Administrator can assign a phone number and an IP to an user account
Administrator can assign a specific phone number to an user account
Administrator can assign a random phone number to an user account
Response time of establishing an audio connection should be reasonable
System must be easy to use for the caller and callee, without any prior training; conform to the norm of a regular telephone
A correct connection from caller to callee is made if the system load can handle it
Contents of an established connection will not be overheard
The failure of one phone will not cause the entire system to fail.
System should be easily extendable to support multiple Administrators
